Role: Senior DevOps Engineer - CIB Data Analytics Technology - AI / Machine Learning Systems - VP
Job_description: As a DevOps Engineer, you will help build a meaningful engineering discipline, combining data, software and systems in order to engineer and maintain data science and AI solutions. Much of our support and software development focuses on building AI and machine learning capabilities in the firm, utilizing internal infrastructure and cloud platforms. You’ll join a team of curious problem solvers with a diverse set of perspectives who are thinking big and taking risks. In this environment you’ll take the lead on relevant projects, supported by an organization that provides the support and mentorship you need to learn and grow. As a DevOps engineer you will focus on the following responsibilities: Architect, develop and integrate 3rd party vendor products to create a platform for speech to real-time and batch text transcription. Participate in the deployment, maintenance and support of speech to text products and systems in production Run proofs of concept to compare vendor solutions Manage the PTO process: progressing speech to text products from development stage to testing to production. Develop a support model for the speech to text products in production Troubleshoot priority incidents, facilitate blameless post-mortems and ensure permanent closure of incidents Identify application patterns and analytics in support of better service level objectives Design self-healing and resiliency patterns Design automated software and product upgrades, change management, and release management solutions This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in an software engineering discipline Expertise in at least one technology stack designing, coding, testing, and delivering software Proficiency in one or more technology domains, may be a cross-domain expert able to solve complex and mission critical problems within a business or across the firm Working knowledge of infrastructure components. (E.g. routers, load balancers, cloud products , container systems , compute, storage and networks) Excellent debugging and trouble shooting skills Experience organizing and executing work around a defined process Desired Skills: Kubernetes AWS Python Telephony or Speech to Text products knowledge The hiring manager for this job opening would welcome a conversation about flexible working. This could range from ad hoc flexibility in a full time position, to a more formal Flexible Work Arrangement. Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You’ll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits. CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world. When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 20 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will are transforming the financial services industry. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you. Ready to use your expertise and experience to drive change? Apply today. © 2020 JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Role: Senior Software Engineer, AI and Graph, Real-World Technology
Job_description: IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward. Senior Software Engineer, AI and Graph, Real-World TechnologyAbout the role We are looking for passionate Software Engineers and Data Scientists to drive development and rapid prototyping of AI and Graph technology products.  Our Real-World Technology division within IQVIA is a fast-growing business, focusing upon delivering tangible results to our clients across healthcare levering software and healthcare BigData. We work with clients to help them use complex clinically rich patient-level healthcare datasets to answer their specific questions globally, make more informed decisions, and deliver results to solves healthcare biggest challenges, from accelerating clinical trials to diagnosing patients with rare diseases. Our ever-expanding range of successful product lines include privacy engines, NLP engines, AutoAI engines or BigData SaaS platforms. In addition, the team curates the world’s largest collection of such Real-World Data from actual patient care settings in 18 countries worldwide, encompassing clinical trial, genomics, EMR, claims and pharmacy data, and is at the forefront of “Big Data” in healthcare.  You’ll work closely with and across the leadership our RW Technology Team including, VPs and Directors owning different product lines and software engineering cells to: Build dedicated software engineering teams in AI-Graph based visualization and associated data mining techniques Develop MVP prototypes based on novel database (e.g., Neo4j, SOLR, elastic), representation learning, semantic reasoning, or visualization techniques (e.g., topological) Work with exiting IQVIA SaaS & AI platforms to re-use technical capabilitiesOur ideal candidate: Experience Strong software engineering skills and exposure to various end-end technology stacks Depth in novel databases (e.g., Neo4j, SOLR, Elastic, GraphLab, GraphEngine, or similar) and representation learning (e.g., knowledge graph, semantic reasoning) Strong ability in visualization techniques (topological analysis, concept maps, graph) Experience in BigData engines (e.g., petabytes of data) and mastery of bigdata science languages (e.g., Python, PySpark / Spark SQL, SPARQL, Cypher) Exposure to cloud vendor tools (e.g., Neptune, Cosmos) Proven hands-on leadership in building software product and data science teams.Our ideal candidate: Abilities Outstanding technical and coding abilities A collaborative mindset and excellent communication skills Proven ability to build strong relationships Fluency in English and excellent oral presentation and writing skills.Offering Competitive Salary and Benefits IQVIA is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success. We believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential. Join Us Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients. Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning. Job ID: R1123946

Role: Python/Platform Software Engineer - Applied AI/ML Systems - VP
Job_description: The team The CIB Data Analytics group is a team of data scientists that work with lines of business to implement modern analytical techniques to solve business problems. The CIB data analytics tech team supports the analytics group by providing platform, tooling and development assistance. The opportunity We aim to revolutionize the way analytical solutions are being deployed to production by teams of data scientists working on diverse portfolio of scenarios and AI use cases. The platform team will empower those teams to develop fast and safely deploy their solutions to production by leveraging existing technologies in the firm and development of new proprietary and open-source technologies for the finance industry. You will be able to learn from experts in ML, engineering and cloud and grow as a technologist. The role We are currently logging for a skilled and experienced software/infra engineer with experience as development manager that will help us in the evaluation and integration of infrastructure that is required by the analytics team, as well as leading a small development team. The successful candidate will work with the team to provide the data scientists, all that they need to be effective in all stages – from data acquisition, to model development, to deployment and monitoring in production. You will interact with scientists and engage with developer communities to deliver the functionality a scientist needs, engineered according to the engineering practices and quality gates. You will use open source in addition to proprietary code and tools, work at hybrid cloud setting, participate in code/design reviews and work in an agile team delivering measurable value to our customers. Furthermore the successful candidate will be tasked to manage a team of 5-6 developers locally, supporting those developers in the execution of agreed deliverables and working with the global development lead to ensure that development practices are adopted or adapted in-line with modern development practices. Additionally the successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on wide range of other projects from the evaluation of specialist hardware such as GPUs and SSD to the integration of complex software such as voice to text services. The job will involve working with a lot of different teams across the bank to make these evaluations successful. Example areas of focus for tooling: Data acquisition and ETL Model training at scale Container based model production deployment Metrics, feedback and production insights Cloud integration (Private/Public) UI development to enable the simplified presentation of data science trained or calculated datasets Our Ideal candidate should: Be vocal! We believe in the wisdom of the crowds and your input is needed and valued! Be flexible! We love to try and change it up by using different technologies and we want you to be open to new and different - Have a strong problem solving skills. We have problems that we want to solve - we need you to help us! Have a deep understanding of Continuous Delivery and modern deployment strategies Be experienced in leading a team of developers to execute and deliver solutions and projects Required skills: Considerable hands on experience developing REST services and platforms for data processing, ETL management or repository management. Expertize in python, (preferable, not mandatory) Hands on experience using Big Data platforms: Spark, Hive and HDFS (preferred). Superb communication and collaboration skills. Higher degree in computer science or engineering. Hands on experience using containers (preferable, not mandatory) Understanding in data science practices, tooling and processes, (preferable, not mandatory) Working knowledge in Java/Scala, (preferable, not mandatory) Experience with AI/ML technologies. Ability to communicate seamlessly across tech and data scientist teams. Experience of 3rd party and open source software installation mechanisms preferred. The hiring manager for this job opening would welcome a conversation about flexible working. This could range from ad hoc flexibility in a full time position, to a more formal Flexible Work Arrangement. Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You’ll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits. CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you. @2020 JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Company Description Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm which was initially established in Paris, France in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with over 1,800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $300m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Testament to its success, Sia Partners has shown double-digit growth every year since inception. With our consultants representing 41 different nationalities, we are a highly diverse team spread across 30 offices in 16 countries. However, using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service. Sia Partners is an equal opportunities employer, committed to diversity, inclusion, and employee well-being. Our diversity and inclusion networks (local and global) contribute to a pipeline of initiatives to enhance employee quality of life and foster a caring environment in which to work. Employees are encouraged to contribute to these initiatives and drive positive change in the organisation across 5 pillars: Women@Sia, LGBTQ+, BAME, Wellbeing and Environment. Job Description Sia Partners is a pioneer of Consulting 4.0, putting us at the forefront of the technology revolution, deploying augmented Consultants capable of leveraging emerging digital technology to enhance and improve their cognitive reasoning, analysis and planning. Supported by Augmented & Artificial Intelligence, Automation and Data Science, we empower our clients to make the right decisions at the right time for the right reasons. The global Data Science capability at Sia Partners consists of 87 Data Scientists located Canada, The Netherlands and France. The new team in London will predominantly support projects across a diverse cross-section of business sectors including Banking, Energy, Defence, Technology and others. You might find yourself working in one or more of the following disciplines to help our clients achieve their aims: Machine/Deep learning and statistics: development of explanatory and predictive models for decision support through the development of algorithms, econometrics, forecasting, quantitative diagnosis, etc. Operational research: assistance in the design and implementation of constrained optimisation solutions and simulation models. Big Data: Algorithmic knowledge for the processing of large volumes of structured and unstructured data (For more information about our Data Science practice, visit our bots showroom : https://datascience.sia-partners.com/. You can also see a video presentation of our AI services & solutions here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hbnEoa9zHQY.) As a Consultant, you will be responsible for… Delivering high quality work with some oversight. Supporting the delivery of projects, potentially working cross several key clients in the UK and, if required, support overseas engagements. Identifying and referring opportunities on projects through industry news awareness, networking and initiative. Contributing to proposal development. Developing an understanding of what the business does and the services your practice offers. Supporting the development of Sia Partners 'assets' and IP including methodology, tools, templates, guidelines, and lead initiatives to continuously improve and integrate them with other Sia Partners assets across the Practice. Supporting the development of blogs and articles. You can expect… A supportive atmosphere, where innovation and initiative are encouraged. A commitment to diversity, inclusion and employee well-being. Opportunities to flex your intellectual and creative muscles. Welcoming, friendly and professional colleagues. A personal development plan with clear goals for advancement. A meritocratic approach to promotion that rewards those who exceed expectations. A competitive salary, in line with the market and your peers. Flexible working arrangements. A performance-related bonus. Health, life, dental and travel insurance. An employer-matched contribution pension scheme. 25 days holiday per year, plus Bank Holidays. What skills and experience are we looking for? Enthusiasm for applying Data Science solutions to business problems. Willingness to take on responsibility on high-value projects with dynamic structures. Excellence in statistics and quantitative analysis (theoretical and practical knowledge, intuition, ability to understand models and apply them). Programming skills in R and/or Python. A solid foundation in other scripting or compiled languages may be suitable. Experience in UNIX/LINUX environments and know-how on cloud infrastructures and code versioning. The ability to adapt rapidly, and work on a range of different business areas within a challenging environment and keeping to tight deadlines. Excellent interpersonal and teamworking skills. Fluency in spoken and written English. Additional languages are nice to have. Qualifications Minimum Bachelor’s Degree (2:1) or international equivalent in a relevant subject: Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or Business preferred. Graduated in the last 2 years or due to graduate this year. Additional Information null

Facebook's mission is to connect the world. At Facebook, we use machine learning across a diverse set of applications to help people discover better content more quickly, and to connect with the things that matter most to them. We strive to find ways to deliver more engaging content in News Feed, rank search results more accurately, and present the most relevant ads possible. In order to meet the demands of our scale, we approach machine learning challenges from a system engineering standpoint, pushing the boundaries of scalable computing and tying together numerous complex platforms to build models that leverage trillions of actions. Our research and production implementations leverage many of the innovations being generated from Facebook's research in Distributed Computing, Artificial Intelligence and Databases, and run on the same hardware and network specifications that are being open sourced through the Open Compute project. As a PhD intern at Facebook, you will help build the next generation of machine learning systems behind Facebook's products, create web applications that reach millions of people, build high volume servers and be a part of a team that’s working to help connect people around the globe. As part of our hiring process, PhD interns are pre-assigned to a relevant team based on their expertise and interests. This internship has a minimum twelve (12) week duration with 2020 start dates ONLY. SOFTWARE ENGINEER, PHD INTERN/CO-OP (MACHINE LEARNING - 2020) RESPONSIBILITIES Develop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, regression, and rules-based models Suggest, collect and synthesize requirements and create effective feature roadmap Code deliverables in tandem with the engineering team Adapt standard machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU) Perform specific responsibilities which vary by team MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Pursuing PhD in Computer Science, related STEM or quantitative field or relevant experience Must be currently enrolled in a full time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship Research experience in a relevant field, such as machine learning, NLP, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, signal processing, data mining, artificial intelligence, or computer vision Experience in systems software or algorithms Experience in C/C++, Java, Perl, or PHP Experience in scripting languages such as Perl, PHP, Python, and shell scripts Experience with Hadoop/Hbase/Pig or Mapreduce/Sawzall/Bigtable is a plus Excellent interpersonal skills, cross-group and cross-culture collaboration High levels of creativity and quick problem solving capabilities Proven track record of achieving significant results Ability to obtain work authorization in the United Kingdom in 2020 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Demonstrated software engineer experience via an internship, work experience, coding competitions, or used contributions in open source repositories (e.g. GitHub) Proven track record of achieving results as demonstrated by grants, fellowships, patents, as well as first-authored publications at workshops or conferences such as ICML, NIPS, KDD or similar Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Confident and experienced in public speaking to large audiences.Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must.Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognised leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in financial services, pharmaceuticals, and technology. An important function within the AWS organisation is Business Development, which is a global function centered around market development for new web services and market expansion for existing web services. AWS is looking for an experienced and motivated technologist to lead a Solution Architecture (SA) team with a passion for creating strategies, best practices and solving complex business challenges focusing on AWS Machine Learning (ML) & Artificial Intelligence (AI) services. At AWS, we are building a team of global technical leaders passionate about growing technology adoption of cloud computing by engaging with technologists, executives and influencers at all levels across the industry. We’re looking for a deep ML technology leader with the business background and communication skills needed to help customers adopt cloud technology to address their biggest challenges and opportunities. In this role, you will lead a team of Machine Learning SAs, who are the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for helping customers and AWS technical teams around the world design solutions that leverage our ML stack, and will have the opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated with a deep understanding of ML services, use cases, architectures, workflow and ecosystem. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value is critical to a Solutions Architect. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges. In this role, you will:Own the technology elements of the global go-to-market field strategy for AWS ML & AI services across EMEA.Lead a team of experts across your area that help customers architect and integrate the ML & AI services most relevant to their businessUse knowledge gained to help shape the future AWS ML portfolio and ecosystem across EMEA.Lead a ML-focused community of AWS technical experts What you’ll need to bring to this role:Technical background to drive an engagement and interact at the highest levels within our customer and partner teams across EMEA.The presence and wherewithal to easily communicate the benefits of cloud computing and ML services for a variety of use cases and application architecturesAbility to think strategically and long-term about the needs of businesses, IT and developersExpertise in ML technologies, architectures and industry that makes you stand out from your peers Key Responsibilities:Together with the broader Business Development and Solutions Architecture teams across EMEA, you will develop the ML strategy for AWS in the field (focusing on technical strategy elements)Engage with Account Teams, Professional Services, SAs and Partners across EMEA to define an engagement strategy across geographies for key customersEstablish technical credibility in sales cycles (personally and through the broader technical team) with customer and partner CTOs, CIOs, Architects, Senior Developers, etc. This role is pan-EMEA and can be based in any of the following locations: London/UK, Dublin/IE, Paris/FR, Amsterdam/NL, Berlin/DE, Munich/DE, Madrid/ES, Stockholm/SE, Zurich/CH & Milan/IT Experience with cloud computing and/or related fields (IT, software, etc)Experience working effectively across internal and external organizations (customers, SIs and ISVs)Technical degree highly desired; or equivalent backgroundExperience developing production applications using ML services, or similar on-prem and cloud-based technologiesExperience working with business development, enterprise account management, strategic partnerships, software development and/or program/product teamsExperience with machine learning and deep learning software platforms. Vanquis is the credit card that helps people who are excluded by mainstream banks take control of their financial situation. Whether they are new to credit or need help rebuilding their credit file to manage life better, we make sure our services are straightforward and suitable for them to succeed. We’re here to put people on a path to a better everyday life, not just for our 1.7m customers but for our colleagues too. We are proud of the difference we make. Your team and role Our Decision and Data Science team operates as the centre of excellence for model development, statistical analysis, and analytical and data innovation within Vanquis Bank. Reporting directly to the Data and Analytics Director, the Decision and Data Science Director is a critical role in the continued growth of the Bank. In this role you'll be directly responsible for: The development of all Marketing, Credit Risk, Regulatory Capital and Impairment, Customer Management, Collections and Recoveries models to optimise customer acquisition and underwriting of new business, line management, pricing, cross-sell and arrears management of existing customers, for both the Vanquis Cards and Loans portfolios.The monitoring of all models in operation developed by Decision and Data Science, ensuring that they are fit for purpose through the development of dynamic model monitoring suites, and the recalibration or redevelopment of these models when necessaryEnsuring that controls and procedures are in place to confirm models adhere to robust governance framework and policy for model development and model monitoring.Driving analytical and data innovation within customer decisioning.Leading a team of 15+ subject matter experts who are highly literate in advanced analytics, statistical modelling and data mining, and make a significant contribution to driving change and creating a positive culture in the analyst community. Providing an efficient and effective shared service for the Bank and the wider Provident Group in the areas of model development, model monitoring and model governance What you'll bring to the teamThis is a significant role forming part of our Senior Management team. You'll be a suitable applicant if you can bring the following mix of essential technical and leadership experience; Proven experience operating in a Leadership / Senior Management role(s) managing large diverse teams and with an ability to manage/influence senior decision makers across a broad and complex organisation Extensive experience of scoping and managing advanced analytical projects. Including developing, and overseeing the development, of multivariate statistical models using both traditional and progressive methodologies - working with large customer or transaction-level datasets Experience of exploring/solving/informing a wide range of commercial issues with a particular appreciation for customer acquisition and customer management strategies Extensive experience of data management within a consumer driven market - giving you deep knowledge of data compliance regulations and principles, e.g. GDPR, POR, PRAAD The following additional experience/knowledge would be desirable; Knowledge of cloud-based analytical platforms Experience working in Retail Financial Services - particularly unsecured lending - giving strong knowledge of relevant financial services legislation and regulation Experience of unsecured lending and working with Prudential, Provisioning and Regulatory Capital models Knowledge of Credit Decisioning systems, e.g. FICO OM, TRIAD, Blaze Advisor; Experian Power Curve Why Vanquis? Our colleagues are the most important part of delivering our purpose to put customers on a path to a better everyday life. If it wasn’t for their amazing efforts, ideas and energy we wouldn’t be the successful business that we are today. So we offer an attractive, competitive salary and benefits package for everyone including: Competitive base salary and rewards Discretionary bonus scheme 25 days holiday entitlement – with one day accrued for each year of service (to max 30 days) Defined contribution pension scheme Shared parental leave Private Medical Insurance for you and your family (partner and dependant children) Extensive opportunities for personal and career development Flexible and dynamic working policies A range of initiatives offered through our Sports & Social and Social Impact Programmes Perks at Work – an affiliate platform offering over 30,000 unique discounts Free tea, coffee and fruit Discounted gym membership

Role: Manager, Household Finance and Economic Data Science - Economics Department
Job_description: Location 12 Endeavour Square, London, E20 1JN Division Strategy & Competition The Role The Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) is currently recruiting an expert Economist and Data Scientist to lead its Household Finance and Economic Data Science team. The team delivers cutting-edge insights and builds out the FCA’s capabilities in two priority areas: (i) Household Finance research – the team produces insightful research and analysis leveraging some of the FCA’s complex, granular consumer data sets to address important questions related to consumer protection and competition in retail markets. As part of this, the team plays a key role in delivering the theme ‘Household Finance & Consumer Behaviour’ within the FCA Research Agenda, including coordinating and partnering with other expert teams (e.g., the Behavioural Economics and Design Unit and the Social Data Science Unit) and engaging and collaborating with leading academics (ii) Economic Data Science – the team plays a key role in integrating social science and data science at the FCA to deepen our understanding of markets and inform the design of effective policy. This involves building out new capabilities at the intersection of economics/econometrics, behavioural science, and broader data science (e.g., machine learning, network analytics, Natural Language Processing), and understanding how these techniques can be combined for new, mission-relevant insights. The team plays a key role in delivering the theme ‘Technology, Big Data & Artificial Intelligence’ within our FCA Research Agenda, including working with other data scientists internally (e.g., the RegTech & Advanced Analytics department, and the FCA’s Federated Data Science Units) and engaging externally on AI and data ethics (e.g., the Alan Turing Institute, the Centre for Data Ethics and Innovation, and the Information Commissioner’s Office).  What does the role involve? What are the key responsibilities? Develop our strategic vision, operational delivery, and technical capabilities in these exciting areas, working closely with the Head of Research and Deputy Chief Economist and others, ensuring that what we do is ambitious, focused ruthlessly on the mission, and makes the best use of limited resources Provide entrepreneurial, inspiring, highly inclusive leadership. This will include building and supporting a team of technical experts (largely economists and data scientists) as they deliver insight, build assets, and grow professionally Sponsor, nurture and help drive impact from research outputs, and our associated research events and seminar series across the FCA Energise and guide effective end-to-end problem solving, helping colleagues frame problems conceptually, develop hypotheses, implement rigorous statistical approaches in big data to test these, and distil findings into impactful, mission-relevant ‘exec-level’ takeaways Drive all investigations and initiatives in a lean, agile, hypothesis-driven way, solving challenges through re-prioritisation and resource allocation as these arise – and helping support strong continued matrix working across the Competition and Economics Division Support our engagement with key internal stakeholders, external experts and other regulators (domestically and internationally), ensuring we’re represented credibly, constructively and effectively, and identifying opportunities for impactful coordination, collaboration and FCA thought leadershipWhat will the candidate get from the role? You will get the opportunity to lead a team that also supports our wider efforts to strengthen the research and scientific community at the FCA and address key enablers for research (e.g., engaging as an ‘active shareholder’ in the FCA Data Strategy). In addition to leading the team, you will be expected to take a full role in leading the department, contributing to its strategy and direction as we deliver on the FCA mission.  Skills/Experience Required Minimum We’re a signatory to the Government’s Disability Confident scheme. This means that we will offer an interview to disabled candidates entering under the scheme, should they meet the minimum criteria for a role. A minimum criterion needs to be measurable from reviewing a candidate’s CV. Exceptions may apply if due to the volume of applications we are not able to interview all eligible candidates who qualify under the scheme. Advanced training in economics, to at least masters level Proven knowledge of modern data science methods, especially supervised and unsupervised machine learning Proven knowledge of causal inference methodologies employing experimental and observational data Experience managing a team, formally or informally Essential Experience leading and developing a team of specialists At least five years of experience applying quantitative methods to economic problems Or you might have a PhD, and a little bit less experience Excellent oral and written communication skills including clear and effective presentation to both internal and external audiences, with the ability to explain complex issues succinctly and with clarity including to non-experts Good analytical capability with appropriate application of judgement and diligence, can demonstrate taking pride in work and ensuring it is of the highest standard Strong stakeholder management at all levels (ability to evangelise) Ability to understand strategic context and prioritise work accordingly, delivering to tight deadlines Desirable Strong understanding of the FCA Research experience in household finance Proficient with at least one scripting language, ideally Python or R Familiarity with cloud computing environments (eg. AWS, Azure) Familiarity with basic software collaboration tools and quality assurance processes (eg. Git and GitLab/GitHub) Aptitude and willingness to learn new tools and techniques quickly and/or support junior staff doing thisAbout the FCA At the FCA, we’re creating a fair and more resilient financial system. We’re establishing more transparent relationships between financial services and their customers, building trust in financial markets and protecting vulnerable consumers. The FCA's Values & Diversity Our ambition is to create a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the society we serve, helping us to be a better regulator. As an inclusive employer, we are open to considering flexible working arrangements. Please contact our recruiter if you wish to apply for this role on a flexible basis. Useful Information This role is graded as Manager, REG D The salary range will be approximately 70,000 to 95,000 GBP plus a competitive benefits package and non-contributory pension Applications for this role close on 6th May If you are interested learning more about the role please contact Michelle Penlington on michelle.penlington@fca.org.uk Please note – Applications must be submitted through our online portal. Applications sent via email will not be accepted.

Do you want to work for a disruptive HealthTech AI start-up, backed by Google Cloud for start-ups, who are changing the UK musculoskeletal market to radically improve clinical pathways and democratise healthcare through revolutionary technology?Are you an experienced musculoskeletal clinician who has research experience in structuring large and complex data?Perhaps you are a PhD graduate or a candidate due to graduate soon? Maybe you work in higher education academia but are looking to move into industry and looking for the right opportunity to make a real difference to patient care?If you have answered ‘yes’ to any of these questions, then this is worth exploring.Operia is working exclusively with an AI HealthTech start-up who are part of the NHS DigitalHealth.London accelerator programme, to search for and headhunt a Musculoskeletal Data Science Clinical Expert.The successful candidate will work hand-in-hand with EQL’s Head of AI and Data Science on a full-time 6-month contract to support their AI capability expansion.In this role, you will critique the evidence base and literature surrounding musculoskeletal care and artificial intelligence, as well as structure large data, and provide your clinical expertise to critique product build. You will be the link between clinical best practices and the technical teams creating cutting edge AI technology.Most duties can be performed remotely, but the successful candidate will be required to travel to EQL’s head office in London approximately 1 day per week.There is an opportunity for this contract to evolve into full-time employment.Interviews can be performed remotely during the lockdown.If you would like a more detailed job description, would like an informal conversation with us, or if you already think this sounds like your next job, please get in touch with Ryan Allen at Operia, or hit apply on this ad.Reference ID: DH/DS/1Job Types: Full-time, ContractExperience:musculoskeletal clinical care: 1 year (Required)Licence:HCPC/GMC (Required)

We rely on data scientists to run a wide range of machine learning methods monitoring for efficacy and degradation, continually improving our forecasting and relationship discovery. Data scientists are critical to the success of EDF trading and take up roles in various commercial functions, ranging from data analytics, market analysis, risk management, quantitative research, pricing, structuring and trading. As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for ensuring the conversion of clean, ordered data into actionable analytics to drive decision making.All about youYou have the skills and ability to: Organise and analyse large amounts of data Determine correct data sets and variables Collect structured and unstructured data sets Use algorithms to mine targeted data You are also: Able to work under pressure with front office users Highly motivated to complete projects and ‘go the extra mile’ to achieve positive outcomes for the business. Able to work as part of a team and communicate effectively with all levels and disciplines Have a graduate qualification in an analytical or science-based discipline e.g. engineering/maths/computer science or equivalentYour technical skills and experienceIdeally you would be proficient in a good selection of the following: Algorithmic complexity theory Numerical stability Parallelism & Concurrency Testability Object oriented design Interface driven design Low latency architectures Numerical, statistical and machine learning techniques. Distributed systems. Real time Big data Visualisation High proficiency in at least one statically typed, compiled programming language, C, C++, Java C# etc. High proficiency in programming in Python and other related scripting languages Experience with messaging and or data streaming technologies such as Kafka, ActiveMQ, Azure Service Bus, and Azure Event Hubs. Experience of hybrid and/or cloud distributed architectures that utilise Hadoop / MapReduce / AWS / TensorFlow /Azure Knowledge of data structures design and use Have experience implanting algorithms and data-structures Have a reasonable grasp of linear algebra, calculus and discrete mathematics

Description Solutions Consultant- Analytics & Monetisation A Solutions Consultant – Analytics &Monetisation is responsible for supporting and providing high impact guidance to our customers, focusing on applying data-driven best practices to optimise publisher revenue within programmatic and direct-sold advertising, for a number of the top enterprise publishers globally. This role has three primary responsibilities: (1) partner with the commercial team to develop a clear understanding of customer business objectives and align strategies to help them achieve their objectives (2) leverage internal connections to bring the most impactful solutions to existing concerns in the client business; and (3) Use creative analytics, digging and product knowledge to enable you and the wider team to deliver game-changing monetisation for key clients. The ideal candidate is a highly analytical, creative problem solver motivated by client success and energised by proactive collaboration with internal and client stakeholders to produce results.  About the team: The Services team is dedicated to earning customer loyalty while building a world-class company together. We look for people who are consultative, analytical, technically minded, and passionate about helping others. Our team implements and supports customers on the Xandr platform, obsesses about making them massively successful, and strategizes to help them surpass their goals. Real-time advertising can fundamentally transform our clients’ businesses, and we bring it to life for them. About the job:This role provides broad exposure as you manage and improve monetisation success of a portfolio of client accounts, with the opportunity to also be directly invested with one primary clientThis position offers extensive learning opportunities, measurable revenue impact and the chance to engage in client-facing consulting and/or data science depending upon your interestsWork with publishers of diverse size, formats and regional marketplaces that call for careful application of the right tool to each jobDeliver analysis by mining data from our sophisticated and extensive data infrastructureDevelop expertise using our proprietary business intelligence platform along with industry-standard SQL, Python and API scriptingTeach best practices to Xandr account & client services teams and learn from their complex client relationships Develop innovative analytic approaches to customer-specific issues and opportunitiesSupport other senior consultants and in-market commercial managers by exploring hypotheses and delivering data-driven insights that motivate change Qualifications About your skills:Quantitative background desired, but flexible if you have demonstrable experience from top-tier advertising, finance or consulting analyticsDemonstrable interest in analytical consulting and passion for operational efficiency Able to solve problems from first principles, then scale standardized solutions across a portfolio of hundreds of clientsExperience with SQL, Python, Excel and or other data mining/analysis tools. Ability to mine, analyse and draw insights from very large datasets and tell a story with data to business stakeholdersTeam player with client service experience who is deadline driven, organised and able to multi-taskAbility to think outside the box, to propose new revenue drivers, which you can adequately test, monitor and use to push through changeStakeholder management and client servicingDemonstrable passion for online publishing, advertising technology, header bidding & marketplaces desired More about you:You are passionate about a culture of learning and teaching. You love challenging yourself to constantly improve, and sharing your knowledge to empower othersYou like to take risks when looking for novel solutions to complex problems. If faced with roadblocks, you continue to reach higher to make greatness happenYou care about solving big, systemic problems. You look beyond the surface to understand root causes so that you can build long-term solutions for the whole ecosystemYou believe in not only serving customers, but also empowering them by providing knowledge and tools

Quantitative Researcher - Data Scientist - Machine Learning Quantitative Researcher - Data Scientist - Machine Learning A Quantitative Researcher and a Data Scientist are needed for a one of the best hedge funds in London. The hedge fund is top tier research and development firm working with cutting edge technology. The company are looking for a talented individual with strong mathematical and statistical skills. The Quantitative Researcher should come from a top university in one of the following degrees: Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Machine Learning or Data Science, and ideally a PhD qualification with extensive research. Some experience in development languages would be ideal.  Due to the nature of the work the opportunity pays very well and offers huge bonuses. The Quantitative Researcher will have the chance to work with some of the brightest minds on truly unique problems. Quantitative Researcher - Data Scientist - Machine Learning

Product Data Scientist London From £40,000-£75,000 depending on experience An innovative FinTech who have received millions in funding over the last year are seeking to expand their Data Science function. This brand have a product that helps their customers better manage their money and they now have millions of customers globally. You will work on advanced data science products, help the C-Suite understand customer insight and commercial analytics. If you are technically savvy in SQL and Python, with the ability to analyse millions of rows of customer data to create commercial insights for a business and increase marketing effectiveness, then this could be the next step in your career. Product Data Scientist Daily use of SQL and Python with a focus on building statistical models (machine learning, churn, regression, propensity, attribution) Analysing the performance of products and analysing marketing trends to inform business strategies Delivering insights and recommendations to diverse stakeholders both internally and externally on how to increase performance, conversion and product diversification You will work on digital projects as well including A/B testing You will work on customer retention and acquisition strategies You will present visualisations on Tableau You don't have to tick all of the boxes but some of the following would be relevant: You will have commercial experience in SQL, Python and product analytics You will have experience within customer insight and marketing functions Ideally you will have experience analysing customer, transactional and/or online data Salary and Benefits The successful candidate can expect to earn up to £70,000! In addition, they have one of the best discretionary bonus systems in the industry, a healthcare package, flexible hours and numerous team benefits e.g. socials and sports clubs.

Data Scientist - 3 months - West London  Global FMCG is looking an experienced Data Scientist to support the commercial organisation in harnessing advanced analytics to drive business performance. The Data Scientist will be accountable for driving the development of advanced analytical models to solve challenging business problems.  The individual will work with multi-disciplinary teams to understand the needs of the business and ensure that model outputs are translated into actionable business insights.  This is a hands-on role and the successful candidate will be comfortable working in an agile environment and capable of leading delivery at pace. Key Responsibilities: Contribute to a culture of agility and close partnership with the business to ensure timely delivery against critical priorities. Partner with leaders in the analytics team and from across the business to understand key business challenges / questions which can be addressed using advanced analytics Apply a broad array of modelling skills including driver analysis, machine learning and traditional statistics, to extract insights from structured and unstructured data sources. This information will also need to be integrated with complementary real-world & digital information streams to address business challenges (e.g. Multi-Channel Analytics, Patient Pathways, Omni-Channel Segmentation, Territory Design, Next Best Action) Actively participate and able to project manage in all stages of model development from data collection, data quality control, model building, model validation, testing and calibration. Collaborate with teams in multiple locations for some complex analyses. Continually learn new analytical skills, techniques and tools to maximise competitive advantage; participate in internal & external technology communities Communicate technical subject matter clearly and concisely to audiences of various backgrounds Provide input on the data architecture and be a contributor to the data governance framework Provide guidance to offshore data scientists and data engineers Partner with external agencies as needed Spring Technology acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers. The Spring Group UK is an Equal Opportunities Employer. By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Spring. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement explains how we will use your information - please copy and paste the following link in to your browser: www.spring.com/candidate-privacy-information-statement To speak to a recruitment expert please contact Krupali Patel

Role: Senior Devops - Applied Data Science for Global Technology Infrastructure - VP
Job_description: Our Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team of innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you’ll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. You’ll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you—and the products you deliver—will thrive. As a DevOps Engineer, you will help build a meaningful engineering discipline, combining data, software and systems in order to engineer and maintain data science and AI solutions. Much of our support and software development focuses on building AI and machine learning capabilities in the firm, utilizing internal infrastructure and cloud platforms. You’ll join a team of curious problem solvers with a diverse set of perspectives who are thinking big and taking risks. In this environment you’ll take the lead on relevant projects, supported by an organization that provides the support and mentorship you need to learn and grow. As a DevOps lead you will focus on the following responsibilities: Lead the DevOps efforts in the team of data scientists and software engineers. Help architect and develop machine learning and AI infrastructure and capabilities. Lead the deployment, maintenance and support of AI and machine learning products and systems in production Manage the PTO process: progressing Data Science products from development stage to testing to production. Develop a support model for the Data Science products in production Troubleshoot priority incidents, facilitate blameless post-mortems and ensure permanent closure of incidents Engage with development team throughout the life cycle to help develop software for reliability and scale, ensuring minimal refactoring or changes Identify application patterns and analytics in support of better service level objectives Design self-healing and resiliency patterns Design automated software and product upgrades, change management, and release management solutions Coach or manage teams as applicable Participate in the 24x7 support coverage as needed This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in an software engineering discipline Expertise in at least one technology stack designing, coding, testing, and delivering software Proficiency in one or more technology domains, may be a cross-domain expert able to solve complex and mission critical problems within a business or across the firm Working knowledge of infrastructure components. (E.g. routers, load balancers, cloud products , container systems , compute, storage and networks) Excellent debugging and trouble shooting skills Experience organizing and executing work around a defined process The hiring manager for this job opening would welcome a conversation about flexible working. This could range from ad hoc flexibility in a full time position, to a more formal Flexible Work Arrangement. When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 20 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will are transforming the financial services industry. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you. Ready to use your expertise and experience to drive change? Apply today. © 2020 JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Role: Principal Specialist - Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence - UKI
Job_description: 7-10+ years of technology-related sales or business development experience3+ years direct field experience working with customers3+ years working domain experience in machine learning, artificial intelligence, or related technologiesExperience in cloud-based technologiesBA/BS degree or equivalent experienceStrong verbal and written communications skills in EnglishAre you energized to create new markets for Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and Deep Learning (DL) technology? Do you love building new businesses? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the pioneer and recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide a platform for IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 2000 companies. AWS customers are looking for ways to change their business models, innovate and solve complex business challenges with artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) technologies in the cloud. AWS is leading the way in providing customers with a broad portfolio of AI & ML services from ML services, such as Amazon SageMaker to AI services (Vision, Languages or Applied Services). AWS is seeking a seasoned AI/ML Principal Specialist to help us scale our artificial intelligence/ machine learning business and work directly with the most interesting and demanding customers to understand their requirements and turn them into reality. Your responsibilities will include identifying market opportunities, building sales initiatives, and managing a healthy sales pipeline focused on driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration. The ideal candidate will possess both a business and sales background that enables them to support an engagement and interact at the CxO/VP level, as well as a technical background that enables them to easily interact with software developers and architects. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus while driving change. The Applied Intelligence business of BAE Systems delivers solutions which help to protect and enhance the connected world. Our solutions combine large scale data exploitation, ‘intelligencegrade’ security and complex services and solutions integration. We operate in four key domains of expertise: Cyber Security, Financial Crime, Communications Intelligence and Digital Transformation. Today, we have staff across the UK and Europe, the Americas, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. Our people apply intelligence to protect and enhance national and organisational assets so that they can grow and prosper – from improving the health and efficiency of leading corporations to protecting critical infrastructures, safeguarding vulnerable people and catching criminals. Together, we make the world a safer place. Make everyday matter.About the Role: Understands how to gain specific insight from data in order to address a business problem. The Data Scientist creatively applies data science approaches to develop analytic results which turn data into information - information into knowledge and insights - and valuable, actionable insights into better decision making and game-changing strategies. The Data Scientist can identify the necessary input data and where to obtain it; they combine, clean and prepare the required data to ensure the analysis is robust. The Data Scientist is able to communicate the significance of the results back to the business as actionable insights and to identify next steps. Data Scientists often work closely with Data Engineers and Solution Architects to embed a specific technique into a production platform.Who We’re Looking For: Understands data manipulation and analysis techniques ranging from data aggregation and Management Information reporting (MI), to statistical-based analytics such as propensity modelling and segmentation, to advanced approaches such as machine learning and predictive analytic approaches. Able to exploit analytical technology including knowledge of coding languages (e.g. R, Python, etc.) Combines core consulting skills with technical versatility as they uncover hidden patterns in data and effectively present results to clients with varying levels of technical understanding. Able to tell stories with data – both verbally and visually, helping key decision makers move from ad-hoc analysis into continual data conversations. Understands different analytic, algorithmic, data mining and data visualisation techniques to find data insights, underpinned by strong core consulting skills. Has an awareness of machine learning. Applies appropriate data analysis, data modelling, and quality assurance techniques, based upon a detailed understanding of problem space, business and processes, to establish, modify or maintain data structures and associated components (entity descriptions, relationship descriptions, attribute definitions). Has an awareness and ability to evaluate analytic technology options. Develops specific technical expertise in commercial and open source products relating to Data Science; able to configure and demonstrate these products. Able to manipulate data through a variety of approaches, including exploratory analysis, scripting and visualisation. Develops knowledge of database concepts, object and data modelling techniques and design principles. Interprets and translates object and data models into appropriate data schemas within design constraints for exploitation. Applies Agile principles to create proof of concepts (POCs) that can be evolved into production applications. Innovates with data and produces rapid outputs, deploying appropriate algorithms. Has awareness of User Centric Design (UCD), data privacy & data security guidelines.About BAE Systems Applied Intelligence We use our intelligence-led insights to help defend Governments, Nations and Societies from cyber-attacks and financial crime. Our customers depend on our evolving capabilities to help them safely grow their organisations. Our unprecedented access to threat intelligence, world-leading analysts and market-leading technology means we can help them to adapt, evolve and stay ahead of the criminals. Division overview: Capabilities At BAE Systems Applied Intelligence, we pride ourselves in being a leader in the cyber defence industry, and Capabilities is the engine that keeps the business moving forward. It is the largest area of Applied Intelligence, containing our Engineering, Consulting and Project Management teams that design and implement the defence solutions and digital transformation projects that make us a globally recognised brand in both the public and private sector. As a member of the Capabilities team, you will be creating and managing the solutions that earn us our place in an ever changing digital world. We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours.Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence. We are proud to have an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential. We also welcome discussions about flexible working. Role: Digital Platform Product Manager - Applied AI/ML Products - Vice President
Job_description: About J.P. Morgan Corporate & Investment Bank J.P. Morgan’s Corporate & Investment Bank (CIB) is a global leader in Banking. The world’s corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. The Corporate & Investment Bank supports our clients around the world providing strategic advice, raising capital and managing risk. Who we are The Digital Platform & Services team is responsible for assessing emerging trends, technologies, electronic platforms, potential partnerships, and for building digital products – that could transform the way we, and our clients, do business. Our team consists of product managers, designers, developers and business representatives. The team is thoughtful in balancing due diligence with speed to market and creativity with discipline in order to produce best-in-class, efficient, thoughtful digital solutions for our clients. Why join? This is a fascinating time in our industry. By now, it’s a cliché that banks will have to embrace technology and innovation if they are to thrive in the years to come. We have already bought into this and are committed to show that we can do it and are looking for others to join. You will: Work on some of the most complex problems imaginable at the intersection of two dynamic industries: Finance and Technology Interact with unbelievably large and fascinating datasets currently not available anywhere else Develop products that can change the way our clients operate, and how Banking is done today Influence decisions on Market Strategy, Platform Strategy, Client Engagement and implementing innovative technology based solutions Interact with other high-performing teams within JPM to inspire innovation and champion change throughout the bank What you will be working on? As part of the Digital Platform team, the Product Manager will partner with all lines of business within the CIB to continue strategic product development efforts, with a focus on Applied AI/ML. This includes: Driving value by bringing ML-enabled products and solutions to teams across the entire firm Working in close partnership with all LOBs (Markets, Operations, Investment Banking, etc.) to ensure product roadmap is collectively aligned to the firms strategic vision, while being mindful of business requirements across the entirety of the CIB Partner with the firm’s data scientists in Applied Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning to tackle problems suitable for machine learning solutions Assist with securing the right data needed for a solution, in the right way, in compliance with the firm’s policies Influence the design of data science solutions to deliver for multiple stakeholders simultaneously Partner with the Digital Platform Technology team to ensure the product vision, roadmap and prioritization is clearly understood and efficiently executed Collaborate with the firms Design and User Experience teams, providing clear requirements derived from user research to develop a best-in-class platform offering Manage the functional and technical requirements of business stakeholders to support their core requirements What you will be working on? As part of the Digital Platform team, the Product Manager will partner with all lines of business within the CIB to continue strategic product development efforts, with a focus on Applied AI/ML. This includes: Driving value by bringing ML-enabled products and solutions to teams across the entire firm Working in close partnership with all LOBs (Markets, Operations, Investment Banking, etc.) to ensure product roadmap is collectively aligned to the firms strategic vision, while being mindful of business requirements across the entirety of the CIB Partner with the firm’s data scientists in Applied Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning to tackle problems suitable for machine learning solutions Assist with securing the right data needed for a solution, in the right way, in compliance with the firm’s policies Influence the design of data science solutions to deliver for multiple stakeholders simultaneously Partner with the Digital Platform Technology team to ensure the product vision, roadmap and prioritization is clearly understood and efficiently executed Collaborate with the firms Design and User Experience teams, providing clear requirements derived from user research to develop a best-in-class platform offering Manage the functional and technical requirements of business stakeholders to support their core requirements Who are we hiring? We are looking for an outstanding, VP-level Product Manager with experience building and scaling an ecosystem of digital products across desktop, web and mobile channels from concept to delivery. In particular, this role will focus on products in the firm’s Applied AI/ML space. You have 6+ years of experience in technology and/or financial services, preferably in a product role You have strong leadership skills and the ability to independently own products or a portfolio of products end-to-end. You have a strong track record of product deliveries You can build consensus amongst a wide range of partners including business owners, technology, operations, legal & compliance, marketing & sales You have a view on what it takes to build a scalable Digital Platform, shared components and services that can serve multiple distribution channels You have experience in organizing, researching and analyzing client needs. You bridge the technical and business worlds, ensuring we are building the right products with a combination of vision, market/user/competitor research and usage metrics You should have experience in Product Management discipline doing business analysis, market/user research, owning roadmap, project management, business and project plans You should be familiar with core areas in applied machine learning such as NLP, computer vision, and personalization You should have experience working with products that harness large data sets and use various machine learning techniques to deliver insights and new features You should be familiar with the data science model development lifecycle (data preparation, model training, etc.) You are a team player and can roll your sleeves up when you need to, and also are able to lead and influence product conversations with all involved parties You have the ability to navigate a matrixed organization and the ability to influence peers by articulating the product offering and value to business partners You are preferably a Markets/Financial products expert, or have a good foundation in finance with the curiosity to quickly pick up subject matter expertise on a specific product set You are highly motivated, resilient and results-oriented. In the end, what matters to us is that when something needs to get done, people come to you to get it done Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You’ll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits. CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world. When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 20 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $10B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will are transforming the financial services industry. We value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you. The hiring manager for this job opening would welcome a conversation about flexible working. This could range from ad hoc flexibility in a full time position, to a more formal Flexible Work Arrangement. @2020 JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.
