WHO WE AREFuelbetter is startup with a mission to help all people live longer, healthier, happier lives by making it easier for them make "nutritionally on target" food & drink choices throughout the day.To this end, our new mobile app is structured as a foodtracking app, like MyFitnessPal (MFP). But Fuelbetter tracks not only calories — it also tracks every macronutrient and micronutrient, most key phytonutrients, and climate footprint (co2 per 100g). Are you getting enough dietary iron, selenium, DHA omega 3s, vitamin D? Are you hitting your dietary carbon footprint target? The app provides meal-by-meal, day-by-day insight into these and more. And it goes one step further: our proprietary Recommendation Engine tells you exactly what to eat/drink to correct that dietary gap or excess.To achieve this, we first had to develop algorithms which accurately estimate the weight of each ingredient in the universe of packaged foods, effectively reverse-engineering every packaged food out there — which we did. And then we had to find a partner who had the largest, most accurate database of packaged foods in the world — which we did. So now, we have a proprietary database — the world's first — with an accurate, detailed nutrient profile of every food.Join us, and you'll be taking poll-position to bring this revolutionary technology to market.ABOUT THE ROLEYou'll be one of the first employees of our start-up — with all the challenges and excitement, all the risk and potential reward, and all the ambiguity and increased responsibility that being in a start-up entails. You'll be pressing the pause button on most everything else in your life over the coming months, working long hours and giving 100% of your time, heart, mind, and soul to help bring our revolutionary technology to market — and working alongside others are doing the same.Over the first 4-8 weeks, you will be plunged into the deep-end, obsessivly focused on improving / polishing the linear & non-linear programming algorithms at the heart of our app, and making them "production ready". (Cue fireworks and fanfare!)As the lead data scientist for our mobile app, you will then take the lead on further development of the algorithms and data resources at the heart of our business, ensuring we stay well ahead of future competitors — including but not limited to:- the further development of our existing linear + non-linear programming algorithms- the patenting of our existing algorithms;- the deployment of additional machine-learning algorithms to complement and (eventually) supercede our existing algorithms, including the establishment of supporting infrastructure (datalakes, Spark/Hadoop, etc);- the application of Natural Language Processing and other techniques to improve how we integrate disparate data sets;- the development + deployment of web-scrapers to assist in building test data sets;- in general, assisting as needed in all data-related work to support the success of our business, including data manipulation, parsing, cleaning, integration, etc.WHAT YOU’LL NEED- This is a London, UK, based role; we can't support relocation expenses or visa sponsorship- 5 years (or above) experience in linear + non-linear programming, machine learning- Fluency in SQL databases, and maching learning tools/infrastucture- Fluency in C#, or else sufficient familiarity in C# to be able to convert existing C# coding to Python- Fluency in Python, or else sufficient familiarity with Python to convert existing Python coding to C#- Advanced degree in Computer Science/Maths/Physics/similar- Work well as part of a team in a fast-paced environment- Excellent communication and organisational skills- Passion or interest in better nutrition / health- Nothing that will hold you back from giving 100%+ of your time, heart and mind to this!BENEFITS- Equity stake (subject of course to conditions)!- Weekly fine red wine tastings!- Improved health & wellness -- by following an app you're helping to create!Reference ID: Fuel004Job Types: Full-time, Contract, PermanentJob Types: Full-time, Contract, PermanentSalary: £60,000.00 to £90,000.00 /yearWork remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Position: Data Scientistmargin-left:-.25pt;text-indent:-.5pt'>Location: Various margin-left:-.25pt;text-indent:-.5pt'>Employment Type: Contract or Permanent About us…  Head quartered in London with offices around the world, Delta Capita is a “challenger” business & technology consulting and manged service provider.  We specialise in the financial services sector and work with many of the worlds most important financial institutions helping them comply with regulatory obligations, transform and simplify operations, reduce cost and adopt innovative business models and technologies. We operate an end-to-end consulting model, including advisory, solutions and delivery capabilities, all supported by high-quality specialist managed services solutions.  Delta Capita is lead by senior industry practitioners, each bringing deep cross-disciplined knowledge coupled with a high level of client empathy. We have proven experience in helping firms innovate and transform their businesses and achieve reduction in their capital and operating expenditure by offering opportunities for achieving industry standardisation and cost mutualisation through consortia and managed utility service models.  Our digital platform offering enables us to be a true innovation partner to our clients by accelerating their pace of fintech adoption, enabling rapid experimentation and delivery of cutting-edge technology through our “engineering as a service” capabilities.  Why work for Delta Capita?  Delta Capita is expanding its Data Science team and looking for talented Data Scientists with hands-on experience of each stage of the Machine Learning pipeline, from data sourcing, through to model training and optimisation to data visualisation.  The candidates will be experienced in the acquiring and processing data as well apply a wide range of Machine Learning techniques to solve particular business problems with emphasis on advanced Deep Learning techniques. A background in Mathematics and/or Statistics is highly desirable.  Core Skills  Supervised Learning - Exposure to the typical regression and classification ML tasks using a wide range of algorithms including, traditional regression, Decision Tree, Random Forests, Gradient Boosting, Support Vector Machines and Neural Networks (RNNs, LSTMs, CNNs, MLPs etc.) Natural Language Processing (NLP) - Experience with a range of NLP tasks such as: entity resolution, topic classification, slot filling for Natural Language Understanding (e.g. NLU models) and Natural Language Generation (e.g. TTS models) in the context of Chatbots, Voice recognition, Sentiment Analysis and Document Classification. Computer Vision/Image Processing - Experience in applying state of the art Deep Learning techniques to the task of image classification, image segmentation and object size measurement Unsupervised Learning Techniques - Including typical unsupervised learning tasks: Clustering, Anomaly Detection, Dimension Reduction (e.g SOMs) Model Interpretability - Experience in applying a range of algorithms and techniques to create interpretable descriptions for deep learning models (e.g Neural Networks), including interpretable surrogate models, knowledge distillation, Shapley Values, etc. Tools and TechnologiesMachine Learning Frameworks - Tensorflow – Keras – PyTorch – Scikit-Learn – XGBoost – OpenCV BigData and Distributed Computing - Hadoop – Apache Spark Data Visualization and Dashboards - Tableau – PowerBI – Kibana Cloud Technologies - Amazon SageMarker – Google Cloud AI Platform Text Processing - NLTK, spaCy, genism, word2vec, glove, fasttext, ELMO, BERT, encoder-decoder architecture Languages and Environments - Python – R – Matlab – SAS – SQL – C/C++

Role: Data Scientist - Customer Segmentation Modelling / Python / R
Job_description: Data Scientist - Customer Segmentation Modelling / Python / RMt client are looking for a Data Scientist with experience in customer segmentation modelling. My client are leading London based data analytics consultancy partnered with Snowflake, Fivetran and Looker. They work with and support some of the world’s largest and well-known enterprise level companies to provide insight into their data enabling their customers to make better decisions, understand their market and increase growth.Ideally they are looking for a Data Scientist with past experience building customer segmentation models along with the usual Data Science tools and technologies such as Python, R & SQL combines with experience manipulating data sets and building statistical modelsAny experience with Dashboards and/or cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure, Snowflake or GCP highly desiredThis position will be worked remotely until COVID 19 crisis is over. They are offering a salary of up-to £60000 per annum with an excellent bonus and benefits package which includes incentives for bring in new business & support for learn new skills and gaining certificationsPlease contact Keiran Baldwin for more informationBenefits:Bonus schemeJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £50,000.00 to £60,000.00 /yearWork remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

Are you ready for a new challenge?  Celonis is one of the world’s fastest growing technology companies and the global market leader in process mining software backed up by our investors Accel and 83North. Our recent $1 billion valuation makes us a “unicorn”, yet with an ever-growing global customer and employee base we no longer consider ourselves a start-up. Instead, we retain the dynamic, innovative atmosphere of a young company with the benefits of a mature enterprise. As we expand into the UK market, we are looking for enthusiastic and talented individuals who are real networking enthusiasts. Take advantage of this unique opportunity to build your career by joining our small team and making a big difference!  At Celonis, you analyse real data from our customers to increase transparency in business processes of any kind. Thereby, you use our Celonis Process Mining Technology in different proof-of-concept projects to demonstrate the value our software generates. Thanks to your conceptional working method, you generate conclusive examples and scenarios during this trial project and focus on the most relevant KPIs to convince our customers of its performance and benefits. In doing so, you react to individual needs of customers from various industries and in conclusion present your findings in front of managers and decision makers.  YOU... …have graduated with an exceptional degree in the area of mathematics / physics / industrial engineering / business informatics / business / economics …have experience in consulting and are highly interested in Data Science and Big Data …think analytically, work in a structured and solution-oriented manner and quickly comprehend new topics and interrelationships …have strong communicational skills and enjoy interacting with various customers to convince them of the value of our software …like organising and structuring workshops for customers and are confident in defending a business case in front of C-Level stakeholders …are fluent in written and spoken English WE... ... see people as the fundamental pillar of our success. Therefore, we invest into the personal growth and skill development of each individual alongside with the strength finder test ... offer attractive compensation models (best-in-class salary, stock option packages, employee referral bonus, family service, flexible working hours, …) ... are visionary and one of the fastest growing Software-Unicorns in the world ... are Process Mining experts and developed the world's most powerful tool for analyzing, optimizing and transforming all IT-supported business processes: the Intelligent Business Cloud ... distinguish ourselves through a unique combination of innovative start-up atmosphere paired with great professionalism and self-responsible work

Role: Full Stack Developer - Big Data, IoT, Machine Learning
Job_description: At Carbon Intelligence , we optimise energy performance in buildings and manage energy and carbon risks for our clients. Fundamental to these services is our industry leading insight and analytics platform ADAPt, which is one of the largest warehouses of energy performance data in the UK from which to draw insight and to change behaviour. ADAPt is built with web, big data, IoT and analytics technologies that delivers actionable insight to consultants and clients.  We are expanding our team and so need a seasoned developer to develop critical components of the ADAPt platform. Key elements of the role will include: Building features and components for ADAPt interacting with users during agile development. Using experience to input into architecture, processes and infrastructure discussions and standards. This is a full stack role. The successful candidate will have a passion to produce the best code both commercially and in their spare time.  Be a role model for junior staff.  To be considered for this role you will have at least 2 of the following skills:  Data Warehouse/ Big Data – designing and optimising React Expert SQL (3 years +) Python and relevant framework e.g. Flask or Django Additional skills we would welcome are: Expertise in JavaScript Architecting front-end code Experience with modern front-end frameworks such as React, Angular 2/4 Front-end web development using HTML5, CSS3 Object Oriented CSS and understand frameworks such as LESS or Sass Understand when to use REST Working knowledge of production issues - load handling, optimisation, caching, CDNs, physical architecture, cloud hosting, etc. Experience in D3.js AWS, Redshift and AWS Data Pipelines UX understanding or design Machine Learning Education: Minimum of degree level (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science or closely related subject This role is best suited for a candidate who: Can demonstrate how he/ she has created functionality, intelligence & value out of a platform Can communicate clearly and concisely with users Is a good, quick, yet quality and test-driven coder, who can peer review code, keep high standards and be a role model to others Has drive, passion and commitment to complement experience with specific technologies. Benefits to you as a successful candidate: Company Culture & The Future  Carbon Intelligence is currently around 60 people strong and is fast-growing (over 50% annual growth in the last 4 years). The company is populated with employees that all have one common purpose; optimising energy performance in buildings along with reducing carbon compliance and reporting risks. The work environment is positive, collaborative, engaging and supportive. Every employee has access to each other, regardless of level. There is an emphasis on clear communication, open-mindedness, and no politics.  There is plenty of opportunity for progression within the company and a genuine chance to be an integral part of our future success.  Employee Benefits  Close support in your professional development enabling you to succeed (all employees have a personal development plan and a personal training budget) Competitive financial compensation appropriate for the role Working in a highly driven and dynamic organisation towards a positive goal Close collaboration and development opportunities with other areas of Carbon Intelligence Company pension Subsidised gym membership Subsidised bike hire Cycle to work scheme 20 days’ holidays Extra holidays for long service plus sabbatical Childcare vouchers Work clothes loan Personal development budget/training/personal development plan  About Carbon Intelligence  Founded in 2009, Carbon Intelligence is a leading London based independent carbon, energy and sustainability services provider with over 150 clients, many of which are household names. The company is expanding through organic growth, and last year moved into new offices in Regent St, W1.  Carbon Intelligence clients spend over £1.5bn on gas and electricity annually. The company has recently introduced an internally built data platform (ADAPt – Assured Data Analytics Platform) to hold and manage significant volumes of energy data for clients. It is a big data platform that collates and verifies multiple large data flows with no limit to the volume, variety and velocity of data that can be processed. It integrates multiple data sets and extracts actionable insights.  The platform has been architected with big data in mind. Current technologies in use are AWS Linux, JavaScript (React, Node.JS, etc), MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Redis, AWS Aurora, SQL, Python, Tableau.  Part of the job involves further development of the platform, the roadmap/ strategy and working on the development process.

Data Scientist  LONDON  Developing products that solve real problems for our customers is at the heart of everything we do. And we’re on the hunt for an exceptional Data Scientist to help shape Quest, our dynamic data platform that’s changing the game in commercial insurance.  The Role  Reporting to our Director of Data Science, the Data Scientist will enjoy working in a highly structured environment. You will be inquisitive, and detail orientated, with the ability to create deep actionable insights, visualise data and build models for all aspects of our products. You will make use of diverse data from commercial insurance, technical pricing and operational policy performance gathered by our customers and internal teams. This is an exciting and rewarding role requiring a smart, disciplined and experienced Data Scientist who is statistically savvy with a very good technical background in the application of Machine Learning (ML) and data analytics techniques.  You You’re in your element getting hands on with various ML algorithms and approaches and you’ll understand the difference between good fit and bad fit. You’ve created several predictive models from scratch, from initial concepts through to robust deployments in production, and you’ll have led all phases of Data Science projects. You possess a deep understanding of all interdependencies, the challenges around data quality and the uncertainties around hypothesis validation. Key Responsibilities Implement algorithms and software needed to perform analysis Analyse and model structured and unstructured data using advanced statistical methods Perform explanatory data analysis, generate and test working hypotheses (A/B tests, Bayesian methods), prepare and analyse historical data and identify patterns and insights Design statistical experiments - formulate test hypothesis and validate them on statistical grounds Design and perform full E2E ML projects including: Data Ingest, EDA, Data Cleansing, Data Pre-processing, ML Algorithm Selection, Data Feature Creation and Ranking, Creating and Training Predictive Models Key Attributes 2+ years professional experience working as a Data/ML Scientist, preferably gained within the Insurance, Financial Services or Risk Management sector Formal Statistical Qualifications from an accredited university in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Bioinformatics, Physics, Operations Research, or related fields Strong data wrangling and processing skills along with proficiency in data analysis and predictive modelling Proven ability to effectively communicate results Very good interpersonal skills and ability to work closely with other members of the data science and engineering team Strong knowledge of: Risk Statistical Modelling, ML & Predictive Modelling and Data Mining Creative approach to building test hypothesis and statistical methodology to design experiments and interpret the outcomes Tools Python Pandas, Numpy, SciKit, programming languages (e.g. Java, Go) and Apache Spark (preferably with pySpark) Supervised Learning (Regression, Classification), Unsupervised (Clustering), Dimensionality Reduction, Model Selection and Optimisation, Feature Selection, Metric Selection, Bootstrapping, Ensembling & Stacking Methods Nice to have Experience with Data Visualisation tools and techniques Experience with Big Data would be a great asset! Experience using Apache Spark (SparkSQL, SparkMlib, SparkStreaming Understanding of Insurance related risk modelling and underwriting processes Track record of working with cluster computing and distributed systems Neural network and deep learning (TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch) Experience with command-line scripting, data structures and algorithms Ability to work in a Linux environment, processing large amounts of data in a cloud environment (AWS, Google Cloud Platform) Benefits  As well as the opportunity to work on projects that you enjoy in an environment you’ll love, we like to look after our team members at Concirrus. Here are some of our perks: Employee share scheme so you get to own a piece of the pie Competitive salary with regular pay reviews 25 days holiday Learning and development opportunities including personal development fund for every employee, and there are no restrictions on what you use it for other than making you better at your job. Spacious, modern offices a stone’s throw from the culinary delights of Borough Market, and with a pub literally on our doorstep. The office is located on St Thomas Street, opposite The Shard Coffee and snacks are all on hand in the office to keep you fuelled. With a beer fridge, Foosball table and Nintendo, because fun is important! Friday FED talks – like TED talks, but you get fed (on us) Regular team drinks, birthday cakes and social events - we have our own Social Committee! Cycle to Work, Season Ticket loan, Pension scheme (generous matched contribution) and more! Plus, we’re always on the lookout for creative ways to look after our employees and encourage them to come to us when they have an idea or need.

Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer (Google Cloud Platform PyTest). Start-up Cloud technology consultancy is seeking a skilled Data Scientist for a three month rolling contract in Central West London; the company is currently offering a remote interview process and WFH. As a Data Scientist you will help migrate on-premise Machine Learning models to the Google Cloud Platform and make them production ready. You'll test and productionise data extraction and Machine Learning models using the PyTest framework and Apache Airflow; refactor feature extraction and prediction models, mainly written in PySpark and maintain clear and coherent communication, both verbal and written, to understand data requirements and report results.  Requirements:Strong experience as a Data Scientist with a good knowledge of Machine Learning models and productionising on the Cloud (Google Cloud Platform preferred but AWS or Azure also fine) Experience of testing ETL and data pipelines ideally using Python and / or PyTestFamiliar with Apache AirFlow and PySpark Strong analytical and problem solving skillsCollaborative with good communication and documentation skills Apply now or call to find out more about this contract Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer opportunity. Job Role: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer (Google Cloud Platform PyTest); Location; London / WFH; Rate: £450 to £520 p/day; Term: 3 months rolling; Start: Immediate / ASAP (remote interview process)

Must know how to code in one of these coding languages: Java, Scala, Python, C#, C++.Additional Criteria/ Better Quality: critical thinking and problem solving, Foundations of computer science such as data structures, memory management, algorithms, and design patterns, as well as networking principles.Education : MUST have a Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Data Science, Statistical Computing, Mathematical Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science: Software Engineering, Information Systems: Software Engineering, Software Development, Information Technology: Programming and Software Development, Computer Science, Computer Systems Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Actuarial Science, Physics, Economics.Years: 1-5 years’ experience, may consider some college grads (Based on their Bachelors concentration)What you will be doing: Learning the latest Big Data Technology: HDFS & SQOOP, Spark, Mapreduce, Hbase, Hive, Cassandra, OOZIE, Flume, Kafka.Sourcing Criteria Combinations:  Coding (Any of the previous languages) and Linux/SQL.C# and Linux/ Optional: SQL, Java and Linux/ Optional: SQL, Scala and Linux/ Optional: SQL, Python and Linux/ Optional: SQLJob Types: Full-time, ContractExperience:Hadoop, Spark or Python: 1 year (Required)

Role: Senior Fraud Data Scientist - Remote Working
Job_description: SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST - FRAUDLONDON, CURRENTLY HOME WORKINGUP TO £90,000 NEW! An exciting opportunity for a Senior Fraud Data Scientist to work with a host of different industries setting up data science capabilities. THE COMPANY This company have a unique proposition to implement real-time, machine learning techniques across fraud and financial crime challenges that different industries are facing. THE ROLE You will be joining as the Lead Data Scientist: Building models with a host of different tools: Machine learning, NLP, Python, Tensorflow, etc. Working directly with clients to make bespoke detection systems Developing new business opportunities Providing technical guidance to junior team members for the end to end design, implementation and optimisation of capabilities YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE Experience in a Data Science, Data Engineering or Advanced Analytics role Strong fraud or financial crime subject matter expertise, including Fraud, Cyber, Transaction Monitoring and Sanctions Experience in the financial services industry is advantageous Advanced skills with Python, Java or similar Prior experience leading projects for clients, ideally in a Pre-Sales, Consultancy or similar role BENEFITS Up to £90,000 Pension Health insurance Bonus HOW TO APPLY Please register your interest by sending your CV to Rosalind Madge via the Apply link on this page. Role: Lead Data Scientist / Head of Data
Job_description: The ctrlio team are looking for a talented lead data scientist / head of data, who is passionate about developing cutting edge data processing and machine learning solutions to drive the next generation of real-time motor insurance pricing services. ctrlio help motor insurers win customers more efficiently and manage their risk portfolios in real-time. Good for the insurer, the channel and, most importantly, the customer. As a small, close-knit InsurTech start-up, you will lead the data science team, working closely with the CEO, CTO, CPO and engineering team. You’ll be building out our data processing and machine learning platform, from mentoring team members on technical matters, through architecting data pipelines and machine learning processes, to collaborating closely with the CEO to shape our approach to using data and solving problems. At ctrlio, every member of our team has an essential voice in defining the product we deliver, and this exciting opportunity gives you the chance to change the digital marketplace. What you'll need to be successful A minimum of 5 years commercial experience as a data scientist in the insurance industry A degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or a related discipline Experience of leading the machine learning and statistical capabilities of a company and the data science team Experience in developing cutting edge data processing and modelling platforms to solve complex business problems, at scale Exceptional communication skills, and the ability to articulate complex problems to a non-technical audience Experience of predictive modelling techniques (e.g. Logistic Regression, Decision Trees etc.) A pragmatic approach to solving hard problems Strong technical experience of data science tools and languages (Python: Pandas / NumPy / Scikitlearn, Jupyter notebooks, PySpark) Nice to have Strong commercial experience in a strategic data role AWS cloud and toolset experience (S3, Glue (Pyspark), Sagemaker, Streaming data) Experience with pricing and predictive modelling in the motor insurance industry What you'll achieve 3 months Become familiar with the ctrlio business Work closely with all members of the team to understand our machine learning goals and explore our datasets Shape how we work as a data science team and take a lead on defining our approach to dealing with data and solving problems Develop high-quality, well validated predictive models on large datasets 12 months Become highly knowledgeable about the ctrlio business Take the lead on all aspects of our data platform and roadmap Be a bastion for quality while helping other data scientists reach exacting standards What you'll get from us We realise exceptional people don’t choose jobs based solely on benefits but we do our best to make sure that you’re set up for success so you can do your best work. At ctrlio you’ll receive a contributory pension, 25 days holiday + 2 duvet days. Plus, the fun stuff, like our annual party, fridge / office stocked with healthy snacks and drinks along with a fab coffee machine for the coffee lovers. About ctrlio Hiring exceptional people who want to build a great company together is our number one priority and we are committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace where everyone is supported and inspired to do their best work. We’re growing fast and there’s plenty of opportunity for you to make an impact – join us!

Role: Data Scientist | Python | Tensorflow | Deep Learning | Contract
Job_description: Senior Data Scientist | Python | Tensorflow 2.1.0 | Deep Learning | CNN | RNN | Contract | Remote GCS are looking for a senior data scientist to join on a 6 month rolling contract with a specialist AI consultancy based in central London. Please see below for what we're looking for:A strong background in Data Science, having worked on AI/Machine learning projects beforeYou must have excellent Python development skills using up to version 3You must have worked with Tensorflow for Deep Learning, ideally having used version 2.1.0You will have strong understanding of CNN (Convolutional Neural Networks) DesirableIdeally you will have worked on Computer Vision or Image Analysis AI projects previously This is an urgent requirement looking to start ASAP, if you're suitable and available please send me an updated CV to gavin.marriott@gcsrecruitment.com or alternatively please call me on 07738210134 for more info. Senior Data Scientist | Python | Tensorflow 2.1.0 | Deep Learning | CNN | RNN | Contract | Remote GCS Computer Recruitment Services is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

Gousto are on a mission to become the UK's favourite way to eat dinner! Delicious recipes, precise ingredients & a dollop of adventure, delivered to your door. We have invested into our technology, data capability and our product to ensure the customer is at the heart of what we do. Every aspect of our business is powered by our passion. Whether it is innovation through our recipe development, building algorithms to optimise our recipe box journey or devising strategies to reduce plastic and food waste. All our teams play a part in our amazing growth in the UK. Our DREAM? To be the most-loved way to eat dinner, and for every meal to leave the planet better off. Gousto is changing how people shop, cook and eat food at home. It’s an incredibly exciting time to join our team!Data Scientist - Menu & Market Tribe An exciting Data Science opportunity has become available in our Menu & Market tribe! Our tribe focuses on ensuring that we are providing our users with the best possible product, by helping them find the perfect recipes and add-ons. Data Science has a big role to play in achieving this, through providing relevant personalised recommendations and working with the rest of the tribe to determine the best ways for users to interact with their recommended recipes, as well as through a Menu Planning algorithm to help the Food team determine which recipes should appear on the menu. We also have many more interesting challenges such as, what makes a perfect menu? Can we build a predictive model to determine how any given menu will perform? Can we personalise the navigation experience based on our users’ behaviours? We tackle these opportunities alongside the rest of the tribe, made of Software Engineers, Product Managers, UX Designers as well as colleagues from the Food, Analytics and Insights teams. If you’re a natural problem solver and are passionate about data, you’ll fit right in. To be successful and more importantly enjoy being a Data Scientist at Gousto; you will be passionate about finding solutions for our customers. Join us and let’s dream big and deliver bigger. Give it some Gousto! Who You Are Adventurer in data science - As a member of the data-science team you will be using advanced machine-learning and optimisation techniques to build tools that will improve the business and make our service highly personalised. End-to-end owner of data products - The problems we pursue are diverse and have a direct impact on the business. They range from optimising flows in our warehouse to algorithmically designing recipe menus based on customers' tastes. We believe that if you build something, you should run it too. Our data scientists take ownership over the entire process from ideation to deployment, as well as automation and maintenance. Knowing our data products inside-out allows us to keep learning and improving. Passionate about impact - We have big plans for the future, hence we are looking for creative thinkers to help drive the business and disrupt the online grocery market by leveraging machine learning and optimisation. You will work with amazing colleagues and look forward to solving challenging problems that will have significant impact on the product and our customers. RequirementsMSc or PhD in STEM subjects would be great! But there are lots of ways to land in Data Science! Math, Stats, Computer Science or BSc paired with strong industry experience Comfortable using SQL Experience with managing productionisation of data products Experience measuring and managing data product performance Great communication skills – being able to explain your work and the impact on the business to all types of business partners High-energy self-starter with a passion for data, attention to detail, and a positive attitudeBonus Points ForExperience in Recommendation Systems Experience in Deep Learning/CNN Experience in Evolutionary Computation Experience in deploying machine learning algorithms into production environments (AWS) Experience with AirflowWhat’s it like working at Gousto? All of us are responsible for the success of Gousto. Our guiding values - dream, deliver and care - show our commitment to innovation, our ambition to hit goals at speed, and our deep respect for the people we work with. Our Values! Dream Be confident in your curiosity: think big, aim high and respectfully stand up for what you believe in. Deliver We look for effective answers that will have a real impact, take initiative to solve problems and have a healthy impatience for change. Care We care about our colleagues, customers and suppliers - they are key to our success - and about where our food comes from, the quality of our ingredients and our impact on the environment. Benefits At Gousto we are constantly looking to evolve our benefits for our people. Employees at Gousto are the key ingredient to our success and growth! Our offices are ergonomically tested for comfort, noise levels and ensuring we have different spaces to collaborate in. Not to mention daily coffee, tea, fruit and ice creams (vegan options too!). We have weekly Friday socials ranging from team updates, birthday celebrations, meet ups and more! Soft drinks, beer, wine and more snacks included! (Well we do love food) Ping pong, gaming events, running clubs to pub clubs, wellbeing days and quarterly people events are just a few of the initiatives in place. With more to be announced in 2020! All Gousto employees are offered a benefits package of: 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays) - You can buy up to 5 days extra holiday! A holiday day added each year (up to 30 days) 40% Gousto discount Your first Gousto box FREE 25% Gousto discount for friends and family Gousto Academy training courses Free food & recipes from the test kitchen Gousto stash - hoodie, notepad, mugFor the full Gousto list of benefits just get in touch and we can share all the details! Equal opportunities Whether it is creating diversity in our recipes or building new teams, we care about our people and the opportunities they have at Gousto. We are committed to equality of opportunity across our organisation. At all levels we promote equality, ensuring our people are consistently treated in a fair and equal manner. Go Gousto!

The University is seeking to recruit one Lecturer in Data Science, who wishes to embark on an academic career conducting research and lecturing on our undergraduate and postgraduate programmes. The post would be ideally suited for a recent PhD in Data Science, or any area including significant expertise in applied statistics. Candidates should have a background that would complement our existing activities, with a particular interest in financial data analysis and/or mathematical biology.  The successful candidate will work closely with departmental academic teams and be expected to contribute to existing teaching and research. The successful candidate will choose one of the University three careers pathways: Teaching and Scholarship, Research, or Enterprise. Candidates interested in the Research pathway will be expected to join one of our existing research teams relevant to their specialism.  You will be able to demonstrate a strong research profile as well as teaching experience commensurate to your career stage. You will have a good first degree (1st or 2:1) in a relevant subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, or applied sciences), together with a PhD.  Should you have any queries please contact the HR Recruitment Team on HR-Recruitment@gre.ac.uk  We are looking for people who can help us deliver our mission of transforming lives through inspired teaching and research, through our values. Job_description: Ph.D. in Machine Learning or a related disciplineStrong publication record at top academic conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, AISTATS, ICLR, KDD, CCS, PETS, etc.Familiar with programming languages languages such as Python, C, C++, Java etc.Very good written and verbal communication skills You: Alexa, I am looking for a new impactful role where I could tackle the next big research challenge, what do you suggest? Alexa: The Alexa Shopping team is looking for applied research leaders/scientists to help me become the best personal assistant. Do you want to hear more? You: Yes, please! Alexa: As an Applied Scientist in the Alexa Shopping team, you will be investigating and developing machine learning and natural language processing technologies to help Alexa turn into the best and most trustworthy personal assistant. The team you will specifically be working with has expertise in deep learning, user modelling, Gaussian processes, probabilistic modelling, information retrieval, crowdsourcing, and other related fields. We employ all these technologies to continually improve the experience of Alexa customers, focusing on the shopping domain. Your work within this team will combine research on machine learning and natural language processing, systems and software development, exploration of new technologies, as well as publications and presentations at top scientific conferences. 4+ years of industrial/academic experience in machine learning, natural language processing and its applications or statistical methodsExperience in serving in senior roles at top academic conferences Take a look at https://www.amazon.science/ to learn more about research highlights and publications from the Amazon science teams. Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates. #NicheTech #NicheTechUK #IRresearch

Role: Full Stack Software Engineer - Venn Portfolio Analytics - London (City)
Job_description: Two Sigma is a different kind of investment manager. Since 2001, we have used data science and technology to derive insights that forecast the future and discover value in markets worldwide. Our team of scientists, technologists and academics looks beyond traditional finance to understand the bigger picture and develop creative solutions to some of the world’s most difficult economic problems. Our work spans markets and industries, from insurance and securities to private investments and new ventures. Venn (venn.twosigma.com) is a fast-paced Fintech startup that is reshaping the way trillions of dollars of assets are invested globally. Founded and backed by Two Sigma, Venn operates at the intersection of data-science, technology and finance. Our product focuses on enabling institutional investors to take advantage of powerful quantitative insights and cutting edge technology to make smarter investment decisions. We currently work with some of the world's largest and most respected investors and institutions and are on a course to create the investment operating system of the future, powering professional investors, worldwide. We are seeking an enthusiastic and experienced full stack developer to build our investor web platform. Using best of breed technologies in the front end, back end, and public cloud, you will build a data-driven solution for the most significant investment objectives that our clients face. This is an ambitious mission, but we are executing on it by focusing on our own strengths and assets and on a scalable platform. You will take on the following responsibilities:Apply creativity, rigor and collaboration to help plan and execute back end and front end development in Java, Typescript, React.js, and other technologies. Participate closely with marketing, business development and engineering colleagues to plan and execute high impact changes Ideate and test and analyze solutions to 'big data' challenges of computation at scale, portfolio management, data analysis and visualization You should possess the following qualifications:A strong academic record with a degree or concentration in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a scientific discipline. Solid experience in Java (or other JVM languages), Python, or C++. Professional Front End related programming experience. Extensive experience with JavaScript / TypeScript and frameworks such as React.js or Angular.js strongly preferred. Strong communication skills, keen attention to detail, readiness to challenge assumptions and obsession with building quality software. While you will work in the data-rich domain of finance, financial experience is not a requirement - just a dedication to building quality software! We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Role: Product Manager, Advanced Analytics - Real Time Payments
Job_description: Company Description Fascinated by the future and captivated by technology? Smart, driven and want to make a difference in the world? You’ll fit right in. Join a diverse team at Visa, where your individuality fits right in. We can provide the opportunity to shape the payments experience globally. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays. Think you know us? Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, reliable and secure digital payment network that enables individuals, businesses and economies to thrive. Individuality fuels our brand and our global team – we’re proud that we are a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. Therefore, we understand that you are much more than your day job. We encourage quality of life outside of the office, whether it’s taking advantage of agile work schedules or our wellness programs, Visa respects and encourages meaningful work/life balance for everyone. In addition, we offer market leading salary and have a fantastic benefits offering. So, if you’re not satisfied with the status quo, we can satisfy your desire to explore new territory, giving you the runway to really make an impact, whilst connecting you with teams around the world in a truly inclusive culture that celebrates our uniqueness. If you think you could support Visa, we want to hear from you – together, let’s make Visa a great place to work. Job Description Visa focuses on building and deploying innovative technologies to enable and secure Visa transactions around the globe. Our mission is to launch new, market-leading offerings that create great value for the payments ecosystem and Financial Institutions, and delight end consumer users as well as meet clear areas of demand for payment and related services. To effect this transformation across the globe, we are looking for leaders who are passionate about innovating and delivering truly differentiated user experiences for specific marketplaces. Successful execution of this role will be achieved through a combination of leadership, payments and product knowledge, innovation and applied strategy in applying Visa’s rapidly expanding payments offerings. Real-time Payments at Visa is a global initiative with regional and market specific teams and efforts. Real-Time Payments is a payment service that enables national infrastructures, supported by value added services across the entire payments value chain and all use cases. Real-Time Payments are positioned to serve both developed and emerging markets covering trillions of dollars in payments volume globally. Organizational savvy and interpersonal skills are critical. This role will interface across all regions and multiple markets and engage with specialized product groups, client consulting, operations, technology, research, marketing and corporate communications. Visa is looking for an individual that pays attention to detail, with a proven record of accomplishment of success in fast-paced environments with demanding timelines, an ability to correlate data and trends to business drivers, who can also contribute to strategic planning, drive change management and lead executive messaging. Qualifications What we are after Successful candidate will be part of a global team responsible for setting up and driving Visa’s Real-Time Payments strategic and go-to-market plans The successful candidate will be a member of the RTP Analytics leadership team, and will take ownership for leading, defining and managing new advanced analytics products and services The successful candidate will have extensive experience in designing and taking products to market that transact against real-time data streams Good knowledge of account-to-account payments and banking, in key areas such as product management and consulting services The successful candidate will have line management responsibilities, and will be responsible for sourcing and hiring talent into its team The successful candidate will be a key input into the external partnerships strategy, being responsible of the product due diligence on potential business partners. He/she will also be a point of contact to the RTP platform product team The successful candidate will have new product development responsibility, and they will be able to lead data science and machine learning engineering teams. Additional Information Think you have what it takes? If you are interested in a career that will challenge and inspire you – we’d love to hear from you! Diversity & Inclusion Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere, is not only our brand promise, it’s the foundation of our company culture. We foster a feeling of connectedness in the workplace, support diversity of thought, culture and background, fight for important initiatives like Equal Pay and actively work to eliminate unconscious biases that hold us all back. By leveraging the diverse backgrounds and perspectives of our worldwide teams, Visa is a better place to work and a better business partner to our clients.

The post holder is expected to contribute to the achievements of the School’s research strategy by developing and then undertaking novel research activities within the ‘use of Machine learning to support solar-plus-storage solution.’ This will involve applying machine-learning approaches to predict energy consumption and generation using solar panels so that energy storage and purchase can be optimised, leading to both lower electricity bills and grid load. You will lead the design and development of the system, and conduct experiments to validate it. The Person You will come to us with a 2.1 or above first degree in software engineering (or a related subject), together with a PhD in a relevant field. You will lead the design and development of the system, and also have responsibility for conducting the experiments required by the comparative analysis. The Faculty There are few faculties across the UK university landscape as varied in their scope as the Faculty of Science, Engineering and Computing at Kingston University. We teach and research across a wide range of subjects, allowing for real cross-discipline innovation and creativity. Our lecturers are experts – working at the forefront of their fields and actively engaged in research so they can bring advanced knowledge to their teaching. Our state-of-the-art facilities include specialist laboratories, a public outreach centre, a specialist virtual reality centre, a rocket lab, scene-of-crime house, flight simulators and a Learjet. For future scientists and engineers, this combines to create the ultimate real-life space for practical learning. For academic professionals, this all adds up to a truly vibrant, exciting environment in one of the largest and most diverse STEM faculties in the sector. Further information This is a full-time position, fixed term for 9 months with a starting salary of £39,343 per annum. Interviews are expected to be held on Monday 18th May 2020. For informal enquiries please contact Hasan Haroglu - Acting Head of Department of Civil Engineering, Surveying & Construction Management. Collaboration is central to how our Data Scientists work. Teams of up to three data scientists work together on projects, alongside developers, product managers, marketeers and journalists. We have offices in more than 35 cities, including London, New York, Hong Kong, Beijing, Manila, Sofia, San Francisco and Tokyo. Department Overview Advanced Analytics (AA) exists to help the Bank make creative use of new data sources and methodologies to promote the public good. While central banks are typically conservative organisations, our division is not! We work flexibility and entrepreneurially across the entire institution including with economists, supervisors, portfolio managers, risk specialists and technologists. Job Description This job is in the Analytics, Research and Outreach (ARO) team in AA. Our team has pioneered the application of new analytical approaches in the Bank, such as machine learning, natural language processing, agent-based models, network analytics, and randomised control trials. Besides being nurtured within an extremely collegial and innovative team, you’ll be part of a cohort of PhDs joining on the Bank’s PhD Research Programme. The programme offers a permanent position for recent PhDs to devote at least 50% of their time to research. The programme includes excellent training opportunities to develop your technical skills and deepen your knowledge in your chosen areas of expertise. PhD researchers on the scheme are expected to publish Staff Working Papers and articles in high-quality journals. They also foster research partnerships with leading academics and other external researchers. And they present their research to policymakers, at external conferences, and often organise internal events. Beyond research, your job will be to deliver other innovative solutions. This will include creating useful tools, dashboards and models for business areas to regularly make the most out of their data. And it will include cleaning, merging and exploring our unique datasets to uncover interesting patterns relevant to policymakers. Role Requirements We value diversity in all its forms, including in terms of disciplinary backgrounds. The division includes linguists, physicists, psychologists and, of course, economists, among other backgrounds. What unites us is a passion for doing state-of-the-art research with (micro or textual) data to inform policy. Applicants will be assessed on the basis of their answers to application questions, a coding exercise, a presentation on past or ongoing research, and a technical interview. The successful applicant will likely be able to demonstrate the following: Knowledge of statistics and machine learning to a graduate degree level Proficiency in programming languages such as R and/or Python Published research in relevant peer-reviewed academic journals A knack for generating innovative research An ability to communicate analytical outputs to non-technical audiences in a clear but rigorous way, both verbally and in writing An interest and/or experience translating models from research papers into practical tools Clearly articulated interest for wanting to work in Advanced Analytics and for a central bank Experience working with granular, messy and/or textual data A caring colleague who takes an interest in others’ work and takes time to help them out Applicants must already hold a PhD or expect to complete their doctorate by end December 2020 The starting salary for this role is £57,000 per annum for the first three years, plus benefits and pensions. The total package includes: a non-contributory pension; a 7% benefit allowance, with the option to take to salary or purchase a wide range of flexible benefits; 25 days annual leave, with the possibility of buying up to 13 additional days; private medical insurance and income protection; and reimbursement of relocation costs for international candidates up to £5,000. We offer a working environment which fully supports individuals through flexible working and wellbeing initiatives including an on-site medical and dental unit. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the hiring process and to do the job. Interested in the opportunity? If you’re still unsure whether to apply, get in touch! Contact David: david.bholat@bankofengland.co.ukWe anonymise applications so hiring managers will not be able to see your personal information such as name and address when reviewing your submission, including your CV. Please complete work history and the application form questions as requested because incomplete submissions may not be reviewed. We continue to build an inclusive culture where everyone can be their whole selves and produce their best work. Our focus on inclusion is intended to build greater diversity in order to reflect the society we serve and be an employer of choice. The closing date for applications is 3 May 2020. Please apply online, ensuring that you answer the application questions, complete the work history and submit your CV.

We are looking for Data Scientists who are interested in using data to draw insights that will result in policy changes or business process optimisation, benefiting the public. The applicant will be scoping projects with stakeholders, using data sets across Government Agencies, applying business acumen to tease out relevant impactful insights, and presenting insights in a clear, concise manner by using appropriate visualisations.  He/she should have some training and working experiences on data analytics, and should be comfortable with hands-on data manipulation, data modelling and data visualisation. He/she should also be comfortable with engaging stakeholders on sharpening their business problems.  The analytics work that we do are typically action oriented and cross-cutting across various domains such as social, economic and infrastructure sectors. Over time, he/she will gain exposure to various policy and ops domains and become more adept in bridging between business users and technical expertise. What to Expect: Work closely with stakeholders to understand their business challenges, scope the problem and develop business case on how to turn data into critical information and knowledge that are actionable and impactful,. Perform data cleaning, pre-processing, feature engineering and build relevant models to conduct meaningful analysis. Apply appropriate visualisation techniques to communicate the insight effectively. Iterate with the stakeholders to perform subsequent deep dives based on the initial insights. Depending on the use case, design of dashboards and interactive visualisations as tools for data exploration and storytelling may be expected. Potentially deployed to other Government Agencies to be their resident Data Scientist. This will involve formulating and implementing strategies to build strong pipeline of impactful projects at the Agency and executing these projects. How to Succeed: Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Quantitative Social Science, or related degrees. Advanced degrees preferred. We will also factor in relevant certifications (e.g., Coursera) Minimum 2 years of relevant working experience, preferably in public sector or data science field Ability to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges Understand key concepts, techniques and considerations in machine learning and data analytics Training and relevant experience in one or more of the following areas: Data science tools such as R, Python Visual analytics technologies like Tableau, Qlik Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem solving skills Team player with strong organization and people handling skills Passion for the use of analytics and data to improve Public Service

Number of vacancies: 2 Preference for Location: London, UKAbout Pangaea Data Limited Pangaea Data Limited provides a machine learning based software product to its customers from the biopharmaceutical and healthcare industry for faster identification of patient cohorts based on phenotypes (clinical characteristics and symptoms) from electronic health records (EHRs) and unstructured doctors’ notes. This is critical for detecting patients at risk of diseases, finding genes linked to a phenotype in the context of drug or biomarker discovery, recruiting patients for clinical trials, conducting real world evidence (RWE) studies and matching the right patients with the right drugs. The company's product has demonstrated that its able to find the right patient cohorts at 50x speed and 30% higher accuracy when compared to alternative methodologies such as rule based natural language processing (NLP), keyword extraction and manual means. The company is headquartered in London and was founded by serial entrepreneurs who have raised more than £130 million through their work and is advised by leading experts from industry, Imperial College London and Stanford University. Pangaea's investors include a UK based Deep Tech fund and renowned angels who founded several UK and US headquartered unicorns. Pangaea has access to 90 million patient electronic health records through its partnerships with hospitals and other such providers from the US, UK, Europe, South America and Asia Pacific.The Role As a Data Scientist in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing, you are involved in the research team. We need our researchers to develop cutting-edge technology which can be applied in our products. You’ll also get a chance to work closely with engineers to productise your research technology. A strong research skills and knowledge on Machine Learning especially Natural Language Processing are essential.What You'll Do Communicate with other researchers, the engineers and the product team on requirements. Research and develop cutting-edge technology on Text Mining and Natural Language Processing (NLP). Applying NLP technology for medical applications.Requirements With university qualification (Bachelors, Masters, Doctorate) who have completed at least two years of university study in Computer Science, Medical Informatics or related. Experience (classroom/work) in Machine learning, Natural Language Processing, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Data Science, Data Mining and/or Bioinformatics. Experience on general programming languages: Python, C++, Java, R. Experience (classroom/work) with popular ML frameworks: TensorFlow or PyTorch.Nice to Have Experience with research communities and/or efforts, including having published papers (being listed as author) at AI/ML/NLP/CV conferences (e.g. NeuraIPS, ICML, ICLR, ACL, CVPR, KDD etc). Relevant work experience, including internships, full time industry experience or as a researcher in a lab.Perks and Benefits Flexible hours and remote working are considered Flexible PTO Allocations for continuous learning and development Base salary coupled with sales revenue based commissions and stock options Opportunity to grow with the company into a senior executive roleContact Details Please email your CV to careers@pangaeadata.ai outlining your relevant experience.Process The interview process will include three rounds. The first round will be a coding (software programming) interview which aims to evaluate your skills of coding and algorithm design. You will be asked to solve 2-3 algorithm problems online within limited time independently. The second and third rounds will be interviews with our senior management which will focus on your technical and personal skills, during which you would be expected to answer questions regarding your CV.General Information Pangaea Data’s headquarters is in London (UK) with teams in San Francisco (US) and Hong Kong. For more information please visit www.pangaeadata.ai.Pangaea Data is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

Experience with open source machine learning packages, such as Pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow. Experience with handling large data volumes with modern data processing tools, e.g. by using Hadoop / Spark / SQL Analytical Techniques Analytical Technology Desk Research Prototyping Quality Assurance and Testing Statistical Modelling Programming (Python, SQL, R,…) Data Interpretation/ Insight Analysis Data Visualisation Insight Storytelling Client relationship building and management Presentation skillsA plus if you also have: PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Physics, Engineering or related field. Life at dunnhumby  dunnhumbians are passionate people who always start with the customer, we are ambitious and decisive, we listen and understand, innovate and explore, and work together to grow one dunnhumby.Here you'll be part of a culture that welcomes participation and discussion at all levels. Role: Research Scientist - Privacy Preserving Machine Learning
Job_description: Our Statistics and Privacy team focuses on establishing step-change improvements to advance our long-term business growth. The team's expertise spans many domains including statistics, machine learning, cryptography and neuroscience. We develop methodologies, design and prototype solutions, and partner with our engineering colleagues to launch these solutions such that millions of advertisers can benefit. Examples include internal and external experimentation platforms, ads delivery optimization for efficient causal outcomes, and the application of privacy enhancing technologies across our ads product stack.  We seek research scientists — both new PhD graduates and industry-experience leaders — to identify new opportunities and build scientifically rigorous systems that enable marketers to improve the efficiency of their advertising spend. Our team works across areas ranging from internal and external experimentation systems to our ads delivery optimization. We also invest towards privacy-preserving technologies for measurement and optimization that enhance technological guarantees for consumer privacy. In additional to leveraging scientific expertise to develop new products, team members are expected to build consensus across product, engineering and business stakeholders as to the strategic merit of our initiatives. RESEARCH SCIENTIST - PRIVACY PRESERVING MACHINE LEARNING RESPONSIBILITIES Identify specific, high-impact opportunities to build new and improve existing privacy-preserving advertising solutions Design and prototype new algorithms, optimization methods, and architectures for privacy-preserving machine learning solutions Build cross-functional relationships with AI, Engineering, Product and Analytics teams to shape long-term product roadmaps with a balance of scientific rigor and strategic considerations Learn new tools, systems and languages quickly as required by the particular project you are working on Develop patent applications, white papers, conference presentations, and publications that are broadly appealing and accessible beyond a core scientific audience MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS PhD in a quantitative field such as statistics, physics, operations research, computer science or mathematics, or MS/MA degree with 4+ years of relevant experience in data science or research science Strong proficiency with Python Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinning * Expertise with at least one of the following privacy technologies: * Secure multi-party computation techniques for machine learning * Differential privacy * Federated Learning, optimization algorithms and protocols * Learning on encrypted data * Homomorphic encryption * Trusted execution environments Proven track record of innovation PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Industry experience with online advertising, optimization and online experimentation platforms Experience developing and debugging in C/C++ and Java Proficiency with Presto, Hive or Spark SQL Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
